description: Controls the step size in pixels for each scrolling movement by j/k (vertical scroll) and h/l (horizontal scroll) keys. Also affects the continuous scroll behavior in combination with scrollFriction setting. Used for fine-tuning scroll speed and sensitivity.
valueDescription: Number of pixels to scroll per keystroke

values.description: Smaller step size for fine-grained scrolling
Medium-small step size used in command metadata tests
Larger step size for faster scrolling (example in README)

notes: Horizontal scrolling (h/l keys) uses half the scrollStepSize value. The actual scroll implementation uses scrollNode.skScrollBy() method which respects the smoothScroll setting. This setting works in conjunction with scrollFriction to control continuous scroll behavior.

example.description: Double the default scroll step size for faster scrolling
